statement.tex: %text If the function $f:\mathbb{R} \rightarrow \mathbb{R}$ be defined by $f(x)=2x-3$ and $g:\mathbb{R}\rightarrow \mathbb{R}$ by $g(x)=x^3+5$, then find the value of $(f\circ g)^{-1}\left(x\right)$. %

reason.tex:
%text $\underline{(f\circ g)\left(x \right)}$ is shorthand for $\underline{f\left(g\left((x\right)\right)}$. And hence, %
\begin{align} f(x) &= 2x-3 \\ \implies (f\circ g)\left(x\right) &= f(g(x)) = 2(g(x))-3 \\ &= 2(x^3+5)-3 \\ &= 2x^3+10-3 \\ \implies (f\circ g)\left(x \right) &= 2x^3+7 \end{align}
